meanings.sent1: The teacher formalises the rules by writing them on the board.
meanings.sent2: The government formalises the agreement with a signature.
meanings.sent3: The cat formalises its ownership of the house by leaving its toys everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The sunrise formalises the start of a new day with its bright colors.
meanings.sent5: The certificate formalises her achievement and hard work.

meanings.definition: To give a definite or fixed form to.
meanings.sent1: She formalises her schedule by writing it in her planner.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor formalises the clay into a beautiful statue.
meanings.sent3: The clown formalises his balloon animals with a magic trick.
meanings.sent4: The rain formalises the shape of the sandcastle on the beach.
meanings.sent5: The architect formalises her vision into a detailed blueprint.
